intro: Tatianyx arnacites, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and marshes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters, producing a showy yellow color. The botanical features of Tatianyx arnacites make it an important species for pollinators and ecological restoration projects.
